H0.text: Liquid water in the air evaporated into a gas is the change in phase that caused the drops of water to form on the outside surface of a glass of ice water after it was placed on a table for 10 minutes.

H1.text: Liquid water in the air condensed into a solid on the outside surface of the glass of ice water that was placed on a table, producing the drops observed after 10 minutes.

H2.text: Water vapor from the air evaporated into a liquid caused the drops of water on the outside surface of the glass of ice water that had been placed on a table for 10 minutes.

H3.text: Water vapor from the air condensed into a liquid, forming the drops of water on the outside surface of the glass of ice water that was placed on a table after 10 minutes.

A4.text: When surface temperature drops, eventually reaching the dew point, atmospheric water vapor condenses to form droplets on the surface.

A5.text: Dew is water in the form of droplets that appears on thin, exposed objects in the morning or evening due to condensation.
